conclusion: Liquid flows out from sources A, B, and C, passes through baffles, and flows into containers D and E.
The setup includes three sources (A, B, C), baffles (angled barriers), and two containers (D - orange, E - pink).
Liquid from A flows downward and hits the brown baffle.
The brown baffle directs liquid from A to the left.
Liquid from A continues downward and enters Container D.
Liquid from B flows downward and hits the cyan baffle.
The cyan baffle directs liquid from B to the right.
Liquid from B continues downward and enters Container E.
Liquid from C flows downward and hits the orange baffle.
The orange baffle directs liquid from C to the right.
Liquid from C continues downward and enters Container E.
Container D receives liquid only from A.
Container E receives liquid from both B and C.
Final answer: Container D will receive liquid from A, and Container E will receive liquid from B and C.
